Title: CVE-2021-44228 - Log4j RCE 0-day mitigation
Description:
A zero-day exploit affecting the popular Apache Log4j utility (CVE-2021-44228) was made public on December 9, 2021 that results in remote code execution (RCE).
This vulnerability is actively being exploited and anyone using Log4j should update to version 2.15.0 as soon as possible.

Title: Bring your own functions to Azure Static Web Apps
Description: Azure Static Web Apps APIs are supported by two possible configurations: managed functions and bring your own functions. This post is about using your existing functions in Azure Static Web apps. Bring your own functions is only available in the Azure Static Web Apps Standard plan. By default Azure Static web apps support only HTTP Trigger functions. It is recommended in use cases like if we want to add some extra triggers like CosmosDB or Queue trigger or we need to manage the functions ourself. Once we enable this feature, we can’t use the default functions support in Azure Static Web App.

Title: Announcing PowerShell Crescendo Release Candidate (RC)

The release candidate is now available for download on the PowerShell Gallery.
